column2: WISCONSIN DMV PRACTICE TEST

1. BAC is expressed in:
column4: ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 2. After stopping for a school bus that is unloading children you should:
column10: watch for children walking along the side of the road.

column2: 3. If you continually pass the other vehicles on a road with one lane in each direction, you will:
column4: get to your destination much faster.
column6: help prevent the chances of a crash occurring due to traffic congestion.
column8: increase your chances of being involved in an accident.

column2: 4. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: stop drinking several minutes before you intend to leave.
column6: make alcohol the focus of the event.
column8: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column10: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.

column2: 5. Parking is not allowed:
column6: on the road side of a parked vehicle.

column2: 6. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column8: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 7. This sign warns that:
column8: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.

column2: 10. This sign indicates:

column6: Slowing down to look at crash scene.

column2: 16. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
17. If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should:
column4: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing.
column6: honk your horn and proceed with caution.
column8: make sure the pedestrian can see you before proceeding.

column6: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.

column4: the truck driver to stop the vehicle.
column6: other drivers when they want to pass the truck.

column2: 34. You are driving on a highway with a single broken white line. Which of the following is correct?
column4: You may cross the line to change lanes.
column6: You may not change lanes unless you are in the left lane.

36. When the road is slippery, you should:
column6: use your emergency or parking brake.
column8: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.

column2: 37. Your BAC depends on:
column6: how much time passes between drinks.

column2: 38. Which statement about taking medications and driving is true?
column4: Cold medications can make a person drowsy.
column6: Over the counter drugs do not affect driving ability.

column10: It is not recommended to check

column2: 41. Drivers should check their rearview mirrors:

column8: to see if a truck is in their blind spot.

column2: 42. When you reach an intersection an intersection with stop signs at all corners, you must yield the right-of-way to:
column4: all drivers approaching from the opposite direction.

column2: 43. When driving in bad weather, drivers should:
column8: increase their speed to get to their destination more quickly.

column2: 44. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column6: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.
